Located at the Oyapock, the border river between French Guiana and Brazil, if you travel overland between these countries you'll probably traverse this town. The town on the Brazilian side is
. A detachment of the French Foreign Legion is stationed in the town.
There has been a bridge over the river since 2011, but until the construction of the Brazilian border station is finished the only way over from

is the traditional one — by boat. The crossing from Oiapoque takes 30-45 minutes depending on the boat. Also, the boats just take a few cars and bringing a car across is expensive. 

From
you can get in by bus (transfer in Régina) or car. There is an airstrip but no passenger flights.
The town is small and you can get anywhere by foot.

value: content=The bridge across the river is probably the most prominent landmark. Until it eventually opens for traffic it will be nothing more than just that.

Fishing, kayaking and rafting in the river.
There are two hotels in the town:
Most people continue their journey either towards
. Until the bridge is open, getting to the latter will involve a boat trip. You could probably also travel upstream along the Oyapock into the rainforest.
